I went to see this film out of curiosity, and to settle an argument. The film is now best known from the suite of music Sergei Prokofiev created to accompany it. I've been looking forward to seeing this film ever since I first caught the trailer, and I'm so glad now that I have. It's truly a beautiful film, and a great introduction to anyone wanting to learn about cognitive impairment.
There is quite a bit of artistic license used in the film, but it's not too far off what memory loss caused by Alzheimer's actually looks like. There are ways to deal with memory loss and some of the symptoms of memory loss.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa, the film follows his life in poverty and his distressing moments, the birth of his experimental literature, and his hidden feelings through Chicago’s performance theater, dance-based silent film, and multi-dimensional special effects. Okay, since you want to know, I'll explain each of those four things and you can judge for yourself. It was creative because everything was convex and went in circles. There was lots of humor, both intentional and not. The film is simply made to be interesting and easy to follow with a romance story.

I'd even say some shades of Hitchcock...this is clearly better than MMM, which is seen as a guilty pleasure by some if not most Woody fans...
